content.rendered:
Pride Mahjong is a variation of Mahjong that uses rainbow tiles instead of the traditional Chinese characters. It is often played as a way to celebrate LGBTQ Pride and culture. Here are some key details about Pride Mahjong:

• The tiles are typically designed with rainbow colors instead of Chinese characters to represent the rainbow flag, a symbol of LGBTQ Pride.

• The rainbow tiles usually represent the 7 colors of the traditional rainbow flag: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo and violet. Sometimes pink and other colors are included as well to be more inclusive.

• While the basic rules of Mahjong remain the same, the rainbow tiles provide a fun twist and allow players to celebrate their LGBTQ identity while playing the game.

• Pride Mahjong is often played during Pride month in June or at LGBTQ events and gatherings as a way to socialize and have fun in a queer-friendly environment.

• It has become more common in recent years as a way to increase visibility and showcase LGBTQ culture through a traditional game. Pride Mahjong sets have become more commercially available.

• While aimed at the LGBTQ community and allies, Pride Mahjong can generally be enjoyed by anyone who wants to play. The inclusive spirit of the game brings people together.

So in summary, Pride Mahjong uses rainbow tile designs instead of Chinese characters as a creative way for the LGBTQ community and allies to celebrate while playing a traditional game. The concept shows how diversity and inclusivity can be incorporated into age-old pastimes.

How to PLay Pride Mahjong

In order to eliminate them, you must locate three food tiles that match exactly. These tiles are positioned on a distinctive layout that can accommodate up to seven tiles simultaneously. Additionally, the game offers three different types of bonuses which can be utilized to facilitate gameplay.
